bill_title: allow persons to place a security freeze on their credit reports without first being victims of identity theft.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow persons to place a security freeze on their credit reports without first being victims of identity theft. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 54-15-3 be amended to read as follows: 54-15-3. Any person who is a victim of identity theft and has submitted a valid police report to a consumer reporting agency consumer may elect to place a security freeze on that person's consumer's report by making a request in writing by certified mail to a consumer reporting agency at an address designated by the consumer reporting agency to receive such requests. This section does not prevent a consumer reporting agency from advising a third party that a security freeze is in effect with respect to the consumer's credit report. Section 2. That § 54-15-1 be repealed. 54-15-1. For purposes of this chapter, a victim of identity theft is a victim of a crime as defined in § 22-40-8. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.04 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
